review: I have a Chromecast, and I recently got the Fire TV stick. So far, I like the stick better, because it allows access to Amazon Prime content I'm already paying for as a Prime member.The biggest downside to the Fire TV stick that I've seen so far is a lack of volume control. The Chromecast app for Android (and I assume iOS) can control your TV's volume. The Fire TV stick remote (hardware or software) can't, for some reason.

author: Amazon Customer

review: This is a fantastic streaming device... When it works. Do a search on "Amazon Fire TV Stick HDCP." This device has a ton of problems with this blue screen of death that says "HDCP unautherised. Content disabled." The worse part is that the menus displays like nothing is wrong. I can load Netflix or any streaming app on the Stick but once you go to stream content the blue sceen of HDCP shows up. So imagine you get home from work, you boot up the Stick, browse for 5 minutes until you find something to watch. Then you go to stream it and BAM blue screen of HDCP. Now you have to get up, walk over to the tv and unplug it, because that is so far the only sure fire solution. This is unacceptable. Every time I unplug my tv I risk damaging it and frankly it's not convenient.If it did not have this blue screen issue I would easily give this a 5 star rating but until Amazon patches this issue I can't give it more then 2 stars.
